p: In this study, we evaluated the entirety of Iranian territory for walnut production using GIS information. Iran has a total area of 1,648,195 km 2 and is the world’s 17 th largest country [ 24]. This study was performed in two phases. In the first phase, land suitability for walnut cultivation in Iran was determined for the present conditions. In the next phase, the effects of climate change were estimated for the next thirty years (2020–2049) in the areas of study. Fig 1 shows the conceptual model used for this study.
